fact: Hell (Jahannam) is a created place prepared by Allah for the disbelievers and wrongdoers.
source: Qur'an 67:6 — 'Indeed, for those who disbelieve in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.'

fact: Hell has seven distinct gates, each for a specific group of sinners.
source: Qur'an 15:44 — 'It has seven gates; for every gate is of them a portion designated.'

fact: Each gate leads to a lower, more severe level of punishment.
source: Tafsir of Ibn Kathir on Qur'an 15:44

fact: The seven named levels mentioned by scholars are: Jahannam, Laza, Hutama, Sa‘ir, Saqar, Jahim, Hawiyah.
source: Ibn al-Qayyim — Hadi al-Arwah

fact: The bottom of Hell is for the hypocrites (munafiqeen).
source: Qur'an 4:145 — 'Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire...'

fact: Hell is vast beyond comprehension.
source: Hadith — Sahih Muslim 2846: 'The sun and the moon will be rolled up in Hell on the Day of Resurrection.'

fact: Hell will be brought on the Day of Judgment with seventy thousand reins, each pulled by seventy thousand angels.
source: Sahih Muslim 2842

fact: Hell is black and dark, with no light except the fire itself.
source: Ibn Rajab al-Hanbali — 'Ahwal al-Qubur' citing earlier reports

fact: The depth of Hell is immense: a stone thrown from its edge would fall for seventy years before reaching the bottom.
source: Sahih Muslim 2844

fact: Hell has layers (darakaat) — opposite of Paradise's levels (darajaat).
source: Qur'an 4:145 & scholars like Ibn Taymiyyah

fact: The bridge (as-Sirat) passes over Hell.
source: Sahih Bukhari 7439

fact: The Hellfire roars with fury and exhalations.
source: Qur'an 67:7 — 'When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [terrible] inhaling while it boils up.'

fact: Hell is enclosed and has gates that lock.
source: Qur'an 90:19-20 — 'But those who disbelieve in Our verses — they are the companions of the left. Upon them is a Fire closed in.'

fact: Its gates are massive and heavy.
source: Imam al-Qurtubi — 'at-Tadhkira'

fact: Hell is beneath all other creations.
source: Reported by al-Tabari and Ibn Abi Hatim (tafsir of 83:16-17)

fact: The people of Hell will be gathered and driven towards it in crowds.
source: Qur'an 39:71

fact: The gates of Hell will be opened only when they arrive.
source: Qur'an 39:71 — 'Until, when they reach it, its gates are opened…'

fact: Hell has keepers (angels) who stand at its gates.
source: Qur'an 39:71

fact: The number of Hell's keepers is nineteen.
source: Qur'an 74:30

fact: Their chief is named Malik.
source: Qur'an 43:77 — 'And they will call, "O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us!"'

fact: Hell has a steep descent; its depth is unimaginable to humans.
source: Sahih Muslim 2844 — 'If a stone were thrown from the edge of Hell, it would fall for seventy years before reaching its bottom.'

fact: The distance between each of its levels is like the distance between the heavens and the earth.
source: Tafsir Ibn Kathir on Qur'an 4:145 and Sahih reports

fact: The names of its seven levels indicate increasing severity of torment.
source: Imam Al-Qurtubi — Al-Tadhkirah fi Ahwal al-Mawta

fact: Its upper parts are less intense than its lower depths, which are reserved for the worst sinners.
source: Qur'an 4:145 and scholarly consensus (Ibn Taymiyyah, Ibn Kathir)

fact: The gates of Hell will be shut upon its inhabitants and never opened again.
source: Qur'an 90:20 — 'Upon them will be fire closed over.'

fact: The gates are massive and locked with iron bars.
source: Tafsir al-Tabari on Qur'an 39:71

fact: Its layers and gates represent justice: each sinner goes to the level fitting their deeds.
source: Ibn al-Qayyim — Hadi al-Arwah

fact: The inhabitants will be dragged to their assigned gates in groups.
source: Qur'an 39:71 — 'And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups...'

fact: When its gates open, it emits a furious roaring sound.
source: Qur'an 67:7 — 'When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a dreadful inhaling while it boils up.'

fact: The Fire itself is conscious and enraged at the disbelievers.
source: Qur'an 67:8 — 'It almost bursts with rage...'

fact: The flames leap up like giant castles.
source: Qur'an 77:31-32 — 'Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress, as if they were yellow camels.'

fact: The walls of Hell are extremely high and confining.
source: Tafsir of Mujahid on Qur'an 90:20 and 18:29

fact: It is a prison with no escape; its structure itself prevents fleeing.
source: Qur'an 18:29 — 'Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them...'

fact: Hell has a covering lid that will be closed over its people.
source: Qur'an 90:20 — 'Upon them will be fire closed over.'

fact: It has layers one above another, trapping people inside.
source: Tafsir Ibn Kathir on Qur'an 4:145

fact: Its size is so great that it can contain all disbelievers from the time of Adam until the last human.
source: Sahih al-Bukhari 4848 — 'Hell will keep saying, "Are there any more?" until the Lord places His Foot over it...'

fact: The gates are guarded by fierce angels called Zabaniyah.
source: Qur'an 96:18 — 'We will call the Zabaniyah.'

fact: There are nineteen chief angels in charge of Hell.
source: Qur'an 74:30 — 'Over it are nineteen [angels].'

fact: The chief of the angels of Hell is named Malik.
source: Qur'an 43:77 — 'And they will call, "O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us!"'

fact: Hell is completely sealed and escape is impossible.
source: Qur'an 78:21-23 — 'Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait... for the transgressors... they will remain in it for ages.'

fact: Hell has valleys, mountains, and pits within it.
source: Hadith — Musnad Ahmad 22939: 'In Hell there is a valley... from whose heat even Hell seeks refuge.'

fact: Each valley is assigned to specific sins, like arrogance or hypocrisy.
source: Ibn al-Qayyim — Hadi al-Arwah

fact: The terrain of Hell is made of burning coals and molten metal.
source: Qur'an 18:29 — 'Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like molten brass...'

fact: There are chains, collars, and fetters embedded in its structure.
source: Qur'an 76:4 — 'Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.'

fact: Its ground burns and its air suffocates; it is not like any worldly place.
source: Al-Qurtubi — Al-Tadhkirah; based on multiple Hadith about its heat and choking smoke

fact: Hell contains chains seventy cubits long to bind its dwellers.
source: Qur'an 69:32 — 'Then in a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him.'

fact: Its walls are extremely thick to prevent escape or outside influence.
source: Tafsir al-Qurtubi on Qur'an 18:29

fact: Hell is in a constant state of rage and boiling.
source: Qur'an 67:7 — 'When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a dreadful inhaling while it boils up.'

fact: The fire of Hell was kindled for a thousand years until it became red, then another thousand until it became white, and another thousand until it became black.
source: Hadith — At-Tirmidhi 2591 (Hasan)

fact: The darkness of Hell is absolute — its fire gives no light, only heat.
source: Narrations from Ibn Mas'ud (reported by al-Bayhaqi)

fact: Its smoke and flames form canopies that cover the inhabitants.
source: Qur'an 56:43-44 — 'And shadow of black smoke, neither cool nor beneficial.'

fact: Hell is described as having 'layers' that sinners descend into according to their deeds.
source: Qur'an 4:145 — 'Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire...'

fact: The terrain constantly shifts — like moving sand dunes of fire.
source: Reported in works of Ibn al-Qayyim (Hadi al-Arwah)

fact: Hell itself will be dragged into the Judgment arena as a living entity.
source: Sahih Muslim 2842 — 'Hell will be brought on that Day having seventy thousand reins...'

fact: The pressure of Hell crushes its dwellers' bones together.
source: Hadith — al-Tirmidhi 2575 (Hasan)

fact: Its gates open only once, to admit the sinners — then close forever.
source: Qur'an 39:71-72 — 'Until, when they reach it, its gates are opened... then its gates are closed behind them.'

fact: Hell's gates are so immense that their hinges alone could crush mountains.
source: Tafsir of Ibn Kathir on Qur'an 39:71

fact: The sound of its opening is like a thunderous roar shaking the heavens.
source: Qur'an 67:7 — 'They hear from it a dreadful inhaling while it boils up.'

fact: The keepers of Hell never show pity or mercy to its inhabitants.
source: Qur'an 66:6 — 'Over it are angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey Allah...'

fact: Its lowest pit is called Hawiyah, the most severe and bottomless place.
source: Qur'an 101:9 — 'His refuge will be the Abyss (al-Hawiyah).'

fact: The floor of Hell burns like a blazing furnace with no place to stand or rest.
source: Qur'an 18:29 — '...Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them...'

fact: The atmosphere is filled with firestorms and scorching winds.
source: Qur'an 78:21 — 'Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait...'

fact: Hell constantly cries 'Are there any more?' showing its vastness.
source: Sahih al-Bukhari 4848 and Sahih Muslim 2848

fact: The flames rise as tall as castles, symbolizing its colossal scale.
source: Qur'an 77:31-32 — 'It throws sparks like palaces...'

fact: There is no exit, doorway, or tunnel out once someone enters.
source: Qur'an 43:74 — 'Indeed, the criminals will be in the punishment of Hell, abiding eternally.'

fact: Hell itself will speak on the Day of Judgment, testifying against those who are to enter it.
source: Hadith — Musnad Ahmad 22939 and Qur'an 41:20-21 (limbs testify)

fact: The fire of Hell is seventy times hotter than the fire of this world.
source: Sahih al-Bukhari 3265 — 'Your fire is one part of seventy parts of the fire of Hell.'

fact: The heat is so intense it melts skin and flesh instantly.
source: Qur'an 4:56 — 'Every time their skins are roasted through We will replace them with other skins so they may taste the punishment.'

fact: Hellfire burns black and gives no light, only consuming darkness.
source: Hadith — At-Tirmidhi 2591: 'It became black and dark; it does not give light.'

fact: The fire penetrates the bones and marrow, not just the skin.
source: Narration from Ibn Mas'ud in Tafsir Ibn Kathir on 4:56

fact: The fire consumes everything but never diminishes.
source: Qur'an 74:28-29 — 'It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing unburned, blackening the skin.'

fact: It renews the bodies of its inhabitants endlessly so they can continue to feel pain.
source: Qur'an 4:56

fact: The fire produces noxious fumes that choke and suffocate.
source: Qur'an 56:43-44 — 'And shadow of black smoke, neither cool nor beneficial.'

fact: The heat causes their brains to boil like seething water.
source: Qur'an 22:19-20 — '...boiling water will be poured over their heads, melting what is in their bellies and their skins.'

fact: The inhabitants' lips will be burned off, exposing their teeth.
source: Hadith — Musnad Ahmad 22939: 'Their upper lips will shrink back until they reach the middle of their heads, and their lower lips will hang down to their navels.'

fact: The fire burns through iron and stone as easily as paper.
source: Ibn al-Qayyim — Hadi al-Arwah, citing early Salaf

fact: The fuel of Hell is disbelievers and stones.
source: Qur'an 2:24 — '...the Fire whose fuel is men and stones, prepared for the disbelievers.'

fact: The stones are sulfur (brimstone) which burns intensely.
source: Qur'an 11:82 — '...stones of baked clay, marked from your Lord.'

fact: The fire feeds on itself and grows stronger over time.
source: Qur'an 104:6-7 — 'It is the fire of Allah, kindled, which leaps up over the hearts.'

fact: It surrounds its inhabitants completely, with flames above, below, and on all sides.
source: Qur'an 29:55 — '...the Fire will engulf them from above them and from beneath their feet.'

fact: Hellfire will pull the skin and flesh off bones like molten wax.
source: Qur'an 70:16 — 'It will remove the scalp.'

fact: Even their intestines will burn and spill out from heat.
source: Sahih Muslim 2989 — 'A man will be punished in the Fire and his intestines will come out.'

fact: The heat will make their bodies swell enormously then burst.
source: Hadith — Sahih Muslim 2851: 'The molar tooth of a disbeliever will be like Mount Uhud and the thickness of his skin will be forty-two cubits.'

fact: The fire makes their blood and pus boil and ooze from their bodies.
source: Qur'an 14:17 — 'He will gulp it but will hardly be able to swallow it, and death will come to him from everywhere...' (Tafsir: describing pus and boiling fluid)

fact: Their faces will be scorched and disfigured beyond recognition.
source: Qur'an 23:104 — 'The Fire will burn their faces, and they will grin with displaced lips.'

fact: The fire produces a terrifying roaring sound as it blazes.
source: Qur'an 67:7 — 'They hear from it a dreadful inhaling while it boils up.'

fact: The sparks of Hell are as large as castles.
source: Qur'an 77:32 — 'Indeed, it throws sparks as huge as a fortress.'

fact: Its flames leap up as high as the sky.
source: Qur'an 55:35-37 — 'A flame of fire and smoke will be sent upon you... and when the sky is split apart and becomes rosy like molten oil.'

fact: Hellfire produces no light despite its intensity.
source: Hadith — At-Tirmidhi 2591: 'It became black and dark; it does not give light.'

fact: The fire pursues and engulfs the people from all sides.
source: Qur'an 18:29 — '...a fire whose walls will surround them.'

fact: The ground itself is made of fire and molten metal.
source: Qur'an 22:19-20 — '...and scalding water will be poured upon their heads...'

fact: Hell contains rivers of boiling water and molten copper.
source: Tafsir al-Qurtubi on Qur'an 22:19-20

fact: Hell's flames emit deafening roaring sounds.
source: Qur'an 67:7 — 'They hear from it a dreadful inhaling while it boils up.'

fact: The heat causes skin to peel off completely and regrow repeatedly.
source: Qur'an 4:56

fact: The inhabitants will cry out from unbearable heat but will get no relief.
source: Qur'an 43:77 — 'And they will call, "O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "Indeed, you will remain."'

fact: Hell has seven distinct layers of fire, each more intense than the one above it.
source: Tafsir Ibn Kathir on Qur'an 15:44 — 'It has seven gates; for every gate is of them a portion designated.'

fact: The food of the people of Hell will be only from the tree of Zaqqum.
source: Qur'an 37:62-66 — 'Indeed, the tree of Zaqqum is food for the sinful...'

fact: Zaqqum is a tree that grows from the bottom of Hell.
source: Qur'an 37:64 — 'It is a tree that emerges from the bottom of Hellfire.'

fact: Its fruits resemble the heads of devils in ugliness.
source: Qur'an 37:65 — 'Its emerging fruit as if it were heads of devils.'

fact: Eating Zaqqum will boil inside their bellies like molten copper.
source: Qur'an 44:43-46 — 'Indeed, the tree of Zaqqum will be food for the sinful. Like molten copper it will boil in their bellies.'

fact: They will be forced to eat Zaqqum despite loathing it.
source: Qur'an 37:66 — 'Then indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.'

fact: They will have no food except from Dari' — a bitter thorny plant.
source: Qur'an 88:6 — 'They will have no food except from Dari'.'

fact: Dari' neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger.
source: Qur'an 88:7 — 'Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.'

fact: Their only drink will be scalding water (Hamim).
source: Qur'an 6:70 — '...and they will be given to drink scalding water which will sever their intestines.'

fact: They will also drink pus (Ghasaq) from the wounds of other people of Hell.
source: Qur'an 38:57-58 — 'Boiling water and pus to taste...'

fact: They will be made to drink a mixture of boiling water and molten copper.
source: Qur'an 18:29 — '...if they seek relief, they will be relieved with water like molten brass, which scalds their faces.'

fact: Their drink will tear apart their insides as it is swallowed.
source: Qur'an 14:16-17 — 'He will be given boiling water to drink; he will gulp it but will hardly be able to swallow it, and death will come to him from everywhere, but he will not die.'

fact: They will be clothed in garments of fire.
source: Qur'an 22:19 — '...garments of fire will be cut out for them...'

fact: Their clothes will be made from molten copper.
source: Qur'an 22:20 — '...and scalding water will be poured upon their heads.' (Tafsir: molten copper garments)

fact: Their shoes will be of fire, heating their skulls from below.
source: Hadith — Sahih Muslim 212 (description of least punished man in Hell having fire under his feet that boils his brain)

fact: Their beds and coverings will also be of fire.
source: Qur'an 7:41 — 'For them are beds of Hellfire and above them coverings (of fire).'

fact: The fuel of Hell is people and stones.
source: Qur'an 66:6 — '...whose fuel is people and stones.'

fact: The stones are sulfur stones, intensely flammable.
source: Tafsir Ibn Kathir on Qur'an 66:6

fact: Even the idols that were worshiped will be fuel in Hell.
source: Qur'an 21:98 — 'Indeed, you and what you worship besides Allah are firewood for Hell. You will enter it.'

fact: The bodies of its dwellers themselves become fuel for its flames.
source: Qur'an 3:10 — '...the Fire, whose fuel is men and stones.'

fact: Hell is constantly fed new fuel so its flames never weaken.
source: Qur'an 2:24 — '...then fear the Fire whose fuel is men and stones, prepared for the disbelievers.'

fact: The drink will cut their intestines into pieces from its heat.
source: Qur'an 47:15 — '...they will be given boiling water to drink that will sever their intestines.'

fact: They will be dragged to drink while being beaten.
source: Qur'an 37:67-68 — 'Then indeed, they will return to the blazing fire. Then they will be told to drink scalding water.'

fact: Their throats will choke on the food, yet they must swallow it.
source: Qur'an 73:13 — 'Food that chokes, and a painful punishment.'

fact: They will beg for cool water but will be denied.
source: Qur'an 43:75 — 'No relief will there be for them...'

fact: Their clothing will be garments of pitch (tar).
source: Qur'an 14:50 — 'Their garments will be of pitch, and their faces covered with fire.'

fact: Their clothes will ignite and burn their skin.
source: Tafsir Ibn Kathir on Qur'an 14:50

fact: Their sandals will be of fire, boiling their brains like a cauldron.
source: Sahih Muslim 212 — 'The lightest punishment in Hell is a man whose sandals are of fire, causing his brain to boil.'

fact: Chains of fire will be wrapped around their necks.
source: Qur'an 40:71 — 'When the shackles are around their necks and the chains, they will be dragged.'

fact: They will be dragged through boiling water and then into the fire.
source: Qur'an 40:72 — 'In boiling water; then in the Fire they will be filled with flame.'

fact: The fuel of Hell is men and stones, showing its massive intensity.
source: Qur'an 2:24 — '...then fear the Fire whose fuel is men and stones.'

fact: The person who will receive the least punishment among the people of the Fire will be a man who will have two live coals placed under his feet, due to which his brain will boil.
source: Sahih al-Bukhari 6562, Sahih Muslim 212

fact: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Our verses — We will drive them into a Fire. Every time their skins are roasted through, We will replace them with other skins so they may taste the punishment.
source: Qur'an 4:56

fact: And they will be given to drink scalding water that will sever their intestines.
source: Qur'an 47:15

fact: They will have a drink of boiling water and a drink of purulent fluid (ghassaq).
source: Qur'an 38:57–58, Musnad Ahmad 8439

fact: They will have no food except from a poisonous thorny plant, which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.
source: Qur'an 88:6–7

fact: Those who are gathered on their faces to Hell — those are the worst in position.
source: Qur'an 25:34

fact: Do those who are thrown on their faces into the Fire think that they are better guided than those who walk upright on a straight path?
source: Qur'an 67:22

fact: If they seek relief, they will be relieved with water like molten brass, which scalds their faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.
source: Qur'an 18:29

fact: They will cry therein for help: 'Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness'... but it will be said: 'Did We not give you lives long enough...?'
source: Qur'an 35:37

fact: On the Day [some] faces will be white and [some] faces will be black. As for those whose faces turn black: 'Did you disbelieve after your belief? Then taste the punishment for what you used to reject.'
source: Qur'an 3:106

fact: Those who disbelieve will have cut out for them garments of fire; boiling water will be poured over their heads.
source: Qur'an 22:19

fact: With it will be melted that within their bellies as well as their skins.
source: Qur'an 22:20

fact: For them are maces of iron. Every time they want to get out of it from anguish, they will be returned to it and [it will be said], 'Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.'
And they will call, 'O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us!' He will say, 'Indeed, you will remain.'
source: Qur'an 43:77

fact: They will be screaming therein, 'Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness.' But He will reply, 'Remain in it, and do not speak to Me.'
The Fire will consume everything until it reaches his bones, and when it reaches the bones it will renew the flesh.
source: Sahih Muslim 212

fact: When the iron collars will be around their necks and the chains; they will be dragged.
source: Qur'an 40:71

fact: The Fire will burn their faces, and they will therein grin with displaced lips.
source: Qur'an 23:104

fact: Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose walls will surround them.
source: Qur'an 18:29

fact: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles.
source: Qur'an 14:49

fact: When it sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.
source: Qur'an 25:12

fact: And Hell will be brought that Day; on that Day man will remember, but how will remembrance benefit him?
source: Qur'an 89:23, Sahih Muslim 2842

fact: And the disbeliever will say, 'Oh, I wish that I were dust!'
source: Qur'an 78:40

fact: Indeed, We have prepared chains and shackles and a blazing Fire for the disbelievers.
source: Qur'an 76:4

fact: Their garments will be of pitch, and the Fire will cover their faces.
source: Qur'an 14:50

fact: The distance between the shoulders of the disbeliever in Hell will be like the distance of three days' travel for a fast rider.
source: Sahih al-Bukhari 6551, Sahih Muslim 2852

fact: The molar tooth of the disbeliever will be like Mount Uhud and the thickness of his skin will be seventy cubits.
source: Sahih Muslim 2851

fact: No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.
source: Qur'an 83:15

fact: Indeed, it will be closed down upon them in extended columns.
They will cry: 'O our Lord, bring us out!' ... and they will be given scalding water which will cut up their intestines.
source: Qur'an 47:15, Qur'an 35:37

fact: Lest a soul should say, 'Oh [how great is] my regret over what I neglected in regard to Allah.'
source: Qur'an 39:56

fact: Every time a nation enters, it will curse its sister nation.
source: Qur'an 7:38

fact: Their eyes will be covered with humiliation; they will not be able to see.
source: Qur'an 68:43

fact: They will not taste therein [any] coolness or drink except scalding water and pus.
And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups.
source: Qur'an 39:71

fact: The Fire is Sealed Over Them.
